title: How to Play African Crazy Eights

steps.headline: Set aside the jokers and shuffle a deck of cards.
steps.description: Use one deck for every 3 people playing.

steps.headline: Deal seven cards to each player.
Place the remaining cards face down in the center of the play area where all players can reach.
Flip the top card from the Draw Pile face up next to the Draw Pile.
steps.description: This starts the Discard Pile. None of the specific card rules (see below) apply to the starter. They only provide a suit and number from which to begin play.

steps.headline: Starting with the player to the left of the dealer, each player in turn must play a card face up that shares a number or suit (or both) in common with the top card in the Discard Pile at the beginning of the turn.
steps.description: If unable to play from his/her hand, the player must draw the top card from the Draw Pile instead. This concludes the player’s turn.

steps.headline: Continue playing until one player is out of cards and becomes the winner.
The winner decides on a new rule to add to the game for the next round and explains it to the group.

text: Set aside the jokers and shuffle a deck of cards. Use one deck for every 3 people playing. Deal seven cards to each player.  Place the remaining cards face down in the center of the play area where all players can reach. This is the Draw Pile. Flip the top card from the Draw Pile face up next to the Draw Pile. This starts the Discard Pile. None of the specific card rules (see below) apply to the starter. They only provide a suit and number from which to begin play. Starting with the player to the left of the dealer, each player in turn must play a card face up that shares a number or suit (or both) in common with the top card in the Discard Pile at the beginning of the turn. If unable to play from his/her hand, the player must draw the top card from the Draw Pile instead. This concludes the player’s turn. Continue playing until one player is out of cards and becomes the winner.  The winner decides on a new rule to add to the game for the next round and explains it to the group. (see Tips for more info) Re-shuffle. Re-deal. Repeat.
